discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Dalgona Challenges CTF Application (Flask/Werkzeug 1.0.1) - Port 5000 - Python 3.13.3

targets.objective: Test the Dalgona Challenges application for common web vulnerabilities including authentication bypass, session management flaws, XSS, CSRF, SQL injection, and authorization issues on the login interface and challenge pages.
targets.rationale: Active web application with login functionality and challenge framework. Limited current functionality but represents main attack surface. Should test for vulnerabilities in authentication mechanisms, static file handling, and any hidden API endpoints.

targets.objective: Test static file serving for path traversal vulnerabilities, directory listing bypass, and access to sensitive files (.git, .env, config files) that may be accidentally exposed.
targets.rationale: Static file handler is accessible and may contain sensitive information or allow traversal attacks to access protected resources. File serving should be tested for bypass techniques.

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] Flask Werkzeug development server running in production-like environment - Server: Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/3.13.3
[MEDIUM] Limited API surface - most expected endpoints (xss25, /api, /admin, /login) return 404, suggesting incomplete application
[LOW] Static assets are publicly accessible without authentication - /static/css/ and /static/img/ directories readable
[LOW] No API documentation endpoints found - /swagger, /openapi, /docs all return 404
[LOW] No source code exposure - .git, .env, app.py all return 404 (properly protected)
